nl.strohalm.cyclos.utils

Class MessageProcessingHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.strohalm.cyclos.utils.MessageProcessingHelper

  • public class MessageProcessingHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains utility methods to process messages
    Author:
    luis

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MessageProcessingHelper() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.String processDate(java.lang.String message)
      Process a message, using the string between # and # as date pattern for today, example: "We are on #MM/yyyy#" on january, 2006, would result in "We are on 01/2006"
      static java.lang.String processDate(java.lang.String message, java.util.Calendar date)
      Process a message, using the string between # and # as date pattern for the specified date, example: "We are on #MM/yyyy#" on january, 2006, would result in "We are on 01/2006"
      static java.lang.String processVariables(java.lang.String message, Entity entity, LocalSettings localSettings)
      Process variables, getting the Map from the entity The target entity should override the appendVariableValues() providing the required fields
      static java.lang.String processVariables(java.lang.String content, LocalSettings localSettings, AccountOwner accountOwner, AccountStatus status, Entity... entities)
      Process variables, getting the Map from the account owner and from the entities
      static java.lang.String processVariables(java.lang.String content, LocalSettings localSettings, AccountOwner accountOwner, Entity... entities)
      Process variables, getting the Map from the account owner and from the entities
      static java.lang.String processVariables(java.lang.String message, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,?> values)
      Process a message, replacing the specified variables between # and # example: "The member #member# paid you #amount# units." with the values map containing member => John; amount => 4 will result in "The member John paid you 4 units".

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        public static java.lang.String processVariables(java.lang.String message,
                                java.util.Map<java.lang.String,?> values)
        Process a message, replacing the specified variables between # and # example: "The member #member# paid you #amount# units." with the values map containing member => John; amount => 4 will result in "The member John paid you 4 units".
